it.polito.computervision.virtualscreen

Class AbstractVirtualScreenInitializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polito.computervision.virtualscreen.AbstractVirtualScreenInitializer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VirtualScreenInitializer, java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    StaticVirtualScreenInitializer

    public abstract class AbstractVirtualScreenInitializer
extends java.lang.Object
implements VirtualScreenInitializer, java.lang.Runnable
    Provides a base implementation, taking care of thread management and callback notification. If the concrete implementation needs to run in a separate thread, this class must be constructed with the threaded parameter set to true. In this case, the startInitialization() call will be considered asynchronous, and it will be executed in a new thread. To notify that the init procedure has completed, the initializationComplete(boolean) method must be called from a separate thread. With the threaded parameter set to false, the startInitialization() call will be considered synchronous (i.e. after it returns it's assumed the screen has been correctly initialized).
    Author:
    giovanni

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public final boolean initialize(VirtualScreen vscreen,
                 HandTracker tracker,
                 VirtualScreenInitializer.InitializerCallback callback)
        Starts the VirtualScreen initialization procedure. This method should be called only once.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface VirtualScreenInitializer
        Parameters:
        vscreen - (In/Out) the virtual screen that needs to be initialized
        tracker - The HandTracker
        callback - The object providing the VirtualScreenInitializer.InitializerCallback.initializationComplete(boolean) callback.
        Returns:
        true if this call is synchronous (the screen has been initialized in this call), false if it's asynchronous (the screen has not been initialized, and the callback will be used to notify its completion).

      • initializationComplete

        protected final void initializationComplete(boolean ok)
        Called by subclasses to notify the end of the init procedure
        Parameters:
        ok - True if initialization was successful, false otherwise
